newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish parliament backs overdue pension rise.
newsitem.headline: Polish parliament backs overdue pension rise.

text.p: Poland's parliament on Thursday supported a constitutional court's ruling that pensioners should be compensated for a pension rise they failed to receive earlier this year.

Legislators voted 445 to two with one abstention in favour of the ruling that pensioners should have been given an additional rise in March, as provided by laws valid until the end of 1995, and not only in September, as required by regulations that became effective this year.

The government has said the pay-out for pensioners, to be made next year, could amount to 8.3 billion zlotys but is likely to be lower because the court had not made clear exactly how much pensioners should get.
Earlier this month, Labour Minister Andrzej Baczkowski said the compensation would add about 2.5 percentage points to the 1.5 percent real-term pension growth planned for 1997.
